title: No private lawsuit relating to SOTs had been successful until

Part of the reason is that U.S. exchanges have long benefited from absolute immunity conferred on them as self-regulatory organizations. However, in a surprising amicus curiae brief in 2017 to the U.S. Court of Appeals for the Second Circuit, the SEC took the view that absolute immunity should apply only in relation to an exchange’s self-regulatory functions and not its market operating practices, which include SOTs. This view is a radical departure from the traditional broad interpretation of the scope of regulatory immunity by the federal courts
